message: Planning on waiting 3 more weeks or so until I reserve a room for the conference days. Any chance there won't be any available then?
I have a non-smoking room reserved and would like to share lodging expenses with someone during the conference.
Actually, are you charged when you make the reservation? Or when you show up?
You are not charged until after you show up @kennethreitz - you should book now to secure the pycon rate.
@jessenoller thanks!
@rubic check out https://convore.com/pycon-2011/pycon-2011-room-sharing-thread/
When's check in? 3pm?
Yes--check-in is 3pm; checkout is 12 noon.
If you haven't already, book a room! I know @gsiegman was having trouble finding available rooms yesterday.
I just booked a room after getting an email from PyCon saying to try it again (because I wrote them yesterday asking if it was full.)
Yep, they opened a new block of rooms up to the website. Not sure how long that will last.
We will keep getting blocks as needed: But online room booking ends today - after today, it's phone onley
s/onley/only
I will stay Atlanta until 18.  I will walk around or attend sprint after 13.  But, I only book for 4 room nights for 9~12.  Are there any suggestion for cheap hotel at Atlanta?
@ThinkerYzu don't know avail currently but try Motel6 downtown about $80/night about 3blocks away

I am working on a resource map for PyCon2011. Let me know of any specific request. I live in the suburbs and will try to help. http://maps.google.com/maps/ms?ie=UTF8&hl=en&msa=0&msid=208921756508650864650.00049c086c68b6ab81ed9&t=h&z=11
See the comments for the "cheap" hotel selected for the pycon: http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60898-d86158-Reviews-Days_Inn_Atlanta_Downtown-Atlanta_Georgia.html
About the "cheap" hotel - it was "selected" because it had rooms - to provide a service to attendees. To the extent that PyCon endorses anything, we endorse the conference hotel.
@graffic Additionally, we are working with the Days in to ensure that anyone from our block there has the best experience they can offer. We're trying our best.

Thanks @dartdog and @graffic for your information. I will stay at Atlanta for a lot days. And, I had already spent a lot of money for airplane (from Taiwan). So, I can not afford expansive room. Thanks, again.
I'll share a room in the "Days". It's only one week. But comments are scary.
@graffic: Do you have a room-mate, now?
My experience of using PriceLine on my iphone at the last minute has had excellent results. I stayed at a Marriot Suites in PDX for < $60 so I'm hoping ATL has similar deals.
Comments for "Days" are pretty scary... I reckon that the Hayatt should be a safe bet?

@jamespaxi  We have worked with the Days Inn to ensure that none of our conference goers have to deal with that. We tried ensure that anyone from our block there has the best experience they can offer. We're trying our best. To the extent that PyCon endorses anything, we endorse the conference hotel (hyatt).

Last year, I did a Priceline bid for downtown Atlanta, 2-1/2 stars or up (judged by where others were staying).   It booked me at Baymont Inn & suites on Piedmont (about a 4 block walk), and it was ...tolerable.  Looks like I managed to get @ a bid of ~$44/night last year (and shared it) - with breakfasts.
